arts.ttl: Fabian Hurzeler gives verdict on January transfer as Brighton unleash 'special' talent ahead of Newcastle
arts.sum: Brighton have found a new midfield gem

arts.ttl: Race for Europe heats up with Brighton and Fulham victories
arts.sum: Brighton went up to eighth, which could become a qualifying position for the UEFA Conference League, just one point ahead of Fulham in ninth. The winners of the FA Cup qualify for the league phase of the UEFA Europa League but if they finish in the top five of the Premier League, their place will instead go to the next-highest ranked team that have not qualified for Europe via their league position.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth aware of Kepa Arrizabalaga 'difficulty' as Cherries identify two replacements
arts.sum: Bournemouth are reportedly considering two goalkeeper targets amid uncertainty surrounding the future of Chelsea loanee Kepa Arrizabalaga.

arts.ttl: Fabian Hurzeler refuses to take credit for impact of Brighton sub Danny Welbeck
arts.sum: Substitute Welbeck coolly rolled home a decisive 75th-minute finish to move the Seagulls to eighth position.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth not good enough in Brighton loss - Iraola
arts.sum: Bournemouth head coach Andoni Iraola says his side were "not good enough" in their 2-1 defeat to Bournemouth in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Brighton lucky to win open & intense game - Hurzeler
arts.sum: Brighton & Hove Albion head coach Fabian Hurzeler says his side were "lucky" to win in their "open" & "intense" 2-1 victory over Bournemouth in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: 'I knew' - Danny Welbeck reveals the secret behind Brighton's winner against Bournemouth
arts.sum: Brightonâ€™s veteran striker scores a classy winner against Bournemouth

arts.ttl: Brighton 2-1 Bournemouth: Highlights, man of the match, stats as Welbeck nets crucial winner
arts.sum: Brighton & Hove Albion move level on points in the Premier League table with Bournemouth after a 2-1 win against the Cherries at the Amex Stadium.

arts.ttl: Brighton player ratings vs Bournemouth: Three 8s as in-form Albion win again in race for Europe
arts.sum: Danny Welbeck scored off the bench as in-form Brighton closed the gap on the Premier League top five to one point, with a 2-1 win over high-flying Bournemouth, at the Amex Stadium.

arts.ttl: Danny Welbeck nets Brighton winner against fellow European hopefuls Bournemouth
arts.sum: With both sides dreaming of qualifying for continental football next season, substitute Welbeck rolled home a 75th-minute winner.
